summary: This batch represents work across multiple product teams including VMS subscription pricing (RTEVMS), Good Chop incident prevention and feature management (GOC), and The Pet's Table infrastructure modernization (TPT). The work includes completing OTP pricing calculations, cleaning up unused feature flags, creating monitoring alerts, and a major initiative to build a new meal-plans BFF service with comprehensive observability and deployment infrastructure.

decisions.rationale: Flag has not received traffic in last 7 days and hasn't been modified in over a month, indicating it's no longer needed

decisions.what: Switch to VMSU product family SKU calculation for VMS family
decisions.rationale: Support different pricing models for active subscribed users vs new users with OTP experience

decisions.what: Mark serializer and validator configuration as Won't Fix
decisions.rationale: Not specified, but likely deprioritized in favor of other implementation approaches

decisions.what: Mark config interface creation as Won't Fix
decisions.rationale: Not specified, but likely replaced by alternative configuration approach

decisions.what: Mark instrumentation setup as Won't Fix
decisions.rationale: Not specified, but instrumentation likely handled differently in the meal-plans BFF architecture

initiatives.name: Meal-plans BFF Service (TPT-2336)
initiatives.description: Build and deploy a new Backend-for-Frontend service for meal plans with full observability, progressive delivery, monitoring, alerting, and operational documentation

initiatives.name: Good Chop Incident Prevention Strategy (GOC-3255)
initiatives.description: Create Databricks SQL alerts to detect anomalies in meal selection patterns and prevent incidents

initiatives.name: OTP Experience for VMS Product Family (RTEVMS-1323)
initiatives.description: Implement one-time purchase experience with appropriate SKU calculations for VMS family products

initiatives.name: The Pet's Table Reactivation Flow (TPT-1984)
initiatives.description: Build and test reactivation page functionality for deactivated accounts

blockers.description: VMSU product family work blocked by RTEVMS-2186
blockers.impact: Delayed implementation of VMS family SKU calculation

technical_patterns.context: Using ArgoCD and Argo Rollouts for safe production rollouts with automatic rollback on error thresholds (10% → 50% → 100%)
Implementing Rate, Errors, Duration metrics in Grafana dashboards for BFF observability
Using feature flags for gradual traffic shifting and rollout control of BFF endpoints
Using OAM manifests for Kubernetes deployment configuration including Vault integration
Using supertest for API endpoint testing and mocking external services for reactivation flows

technical_patterns.pattern: Secrets management with Vault Secrets Operator
technical_patterns.context: Injecting secrets from Vault into applications via Kubernetes operators rather than direct API calls
Defining alerting rules for error rates, latency thresholds, and resource exhaustion with OpsGenie integration
Using NestJS JSON logger for consistent log formatting and querying in Loki
Investigating compatibility for migrating from product API V1 to V2 before deprecation
Using Databricks SQL queries to detect anomalies in meal selection patterns for incident prevention

dependencies.context: VMSU product family work blocked by another ticket
Squad needs on-call training and documentation before taking ownership of BFF operations
BFF requires secrets from existing Vault namespace for staging and production
Deployment pipeline depends on ArgoCD for progressive delivery
Incident prevention alerts depend on Databricks SQL query capabilities
Need to migrate before V1 deprecation, requires compatibility validation
